content:
Doctor Note - Visit Date: 2025-09-06
Patient: Priya Singh, Age 42
Chief Complaint: Persistent cough, fever (101F), body ache
Exam Findings: Crackles in right lower lung, O2 saturation 92%
Assessment: Suspected pneumonia
Plan: Order Chest X-ray, prescribe Azithromycin (if no allergies), advise rest and fluids.
Follow-up: Re-evaluate after 5 days or if symptoms worsen.

Lab Report - Blood Panel
Patient: Amit Sharma, Age 35

Hemoglobin: 12.2 g/dL (Normal: 13.8–17.2) → Slightly low
WBC Count: 11,500 /µL (Normal: 4,000–11,000) → Mildly elevated
Blood Sugar (Fasting): 142 mg/dL (Normal: <100) → High

Interpretation (for patient): 
- You may have mild anemia (low hemoglobin).
- Your white blood cell count suggests possible infection or inflammation.
- Your blood sugar is higher than normal, could indicate pre-diabetes or diabetes.

Recommendation: Consult physician for further evaluation, diet changes, repeat sugar test in 2 weeks.

Patient ID: P10234
Name: Ramesh Kumar
Age: 56
Symptoms: Shortness of breath, mild chest pain, fatigue
Past History: Hypertension, Type 2 Diabetes
Allergies: Penicillin
Current Medication: Metformin, Amlodipine
Notes: Patient reports worsening fatigue in last 5 days. 
Suggested next steps: ECG, Chest X-ray, consult cardiologist.
